fi.grimripper.loww.tiles

Class Terrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.grimripper.loww.tiles.Terrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdditionalProperties

    public class Terrain
extends java.lang.Object
implements AdditionalProperties
    Terrain for tiles: has a movement cost and height. Can also have miscellaneous properties that affect how movement modes and movement modifiers treat the terrain. There's some support for terrain that has special effects. The terrain object is notified when it's set to a tile and can add movement events and such at that time. The terrain object is also notified when removed from a tile.
    Author:
    Marko Tuominen

        public AdditionalProperties.Properties getProperties()
        Description copied from interface: AdditionalProperties
        Gets the object's properties.
        Specified by:
        getProperties in interface AdditionalProperties
        Returns:
        a handler for the object's additional properties (can be null if the object doesn't have additional properties)

      • getCost

        public float getCost()
        Gets the terrain's unmodified movement cost. Movement modifiers can alter the cost.
        Returns:
        base movement cost of this terrain

      • getHeight

        public Height getHeight()
        Gets the terrain's height.
        Returns:
        base height of this terrain without obstacles

      • setToTile

        public void setToTile(Tile tile)
        Initializes special effects when the terrain is set to a tile. By default there are no such effects and this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        tile - attach any events, listeners etc. to this tile

      • removeFromTile

        public void removeFromTile(Tile tile)
        Removes special effects from a tile when the terrain is removed. By default there are no such effects and this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        tile - remove any events, listeners etc. from this tile
